summary: This document is a sealed motion filed by the United States requesting an order for the disclosure of records from Cingular Wireless related to Jeffrey Epstein as part of an ongoing criminal investigation. The motion outlines the legal basis for sealing the documents and the potential risks of disclosing the existence of the motion, including the destruction of evidence and flight from prosecution.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Acosta filed the motion on behalf of the United States to request the disclosure of records from Cingular Wireless related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the primary subject of the investigation, with allegations of engaging in illicit sexual conduct and prostitution involving minors.

persons.name: Clarence Maddox
persons.context: Maddox is mentioned as the Clerk of the U.S. District Court who filed the documents.

persons.name: R. Johnson
persons.context: Johnson is the magistrate judge who ordered the sealing of the motion and the records requested from Cingular Wireless.

persons.name: Kellen
persons.context: Kellen is identified as Epstein's assistant who contacted girls to arrange 'massage' appointments.

connections.description: Kellen is Epstein's assistant, involved in arranging appointments for girls to visit Epstein.
Acosta represents the United States in prosecuting Epstein for alleged criminal activities.

events.title: Investigation Initiation
events.description: The City of Palm Beach Police Department began investigating Jeffrey Epstein following allegations from a fourteen-year-old girl.

events.title: Motion to Seal
events.description: The United States filed a motion to seal the request for disclosure of records from Cingular Wireless related to Epstein.

keyFacts: The document is a sealed motion filed by the U.S. government to obtain records from Cingular Wireless related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The investigation involves allegations of Epstein engaging in sexual activities with minors.
The motion outlines potential risks of disclosing the existence of the motion, including evidence tampering and flight from prosecution.
The investigation began in October 2005 after a fourteen-year-old girl reported being paid by Epstein for sexual acts.
The document includes a request for specific records related to Epstein's communications and activities.
